timeline.message: MINOR: QuotaViolationException should avoid String.format and stack trace

timeline.bodyText: I think we want to make the string computation lazy, but not lose info. We could do that by overriding toString.
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Great idea. I don't think it's currently used but it seems helpful. I'll change that.
replies.author: lbradstreet

replies.bodyText:
I've fixed this. toString for an example violation before and after both returned:
org.apache.kafka.common.metrics.QuotaViolationException: 'MetricName [name=x, group=y, description=z, tags={}]' violated quota. Actual: 3.300000, Threshold: 3.300000
replies.author: lbradstreet

replies.bodyText: Can we remove the allocation altogether in the constructor?
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Good point, now that toString is overridden I had actually just made that change and hadn't pushed it
replies.author: lbradstreet

timeline.bodyText: Do we need String.format here? Seems like String concat would be fine.
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Sounds good. I figured it wasn't used so simply moved it but seems better to be safe.
replies.author: lbradstreet

timeline.message: Avoid string building, rely on toString now

Avoid String.format use, avoid exceptional control flow in
ReplicationQuotaManager.
